page.title: 19SUMMARY
page.content: IT IS NO EXAGGERATION TO SAY THAT IN A CHANGING WORLD THE SURVEY AREA IS CHANGING MORE RAPIDLY THAN MOST. PHYSICALLY, IT HAS CHANGED LITTLE, AND WHAT CHANGES THERE HAVE BEEN HAVE BEEN FOR THE BETTER. THE DUCHY HAVE RECENTLY GIVEN PERMISSION FOR THE EXTRACTION OF MINE WASTE AT LUCKETT, THE WORK AND REINSTATEMENT OF THE LANDSCAPE TO TAKE UP TO A YEAR TO COMPLETE. RATHER THE CHANGES HAVE BEEN IN THE POPULATION AND THE DIFFERENT ATTITUDES AND LIFE STYLES THE NEWCOMERS HAVE BROUGHT TO THE AREA. FOR THE MOST PART, THE INTEGRATION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFUL WITH LITTLE RESENTMENT OR SUSPICION ON EITHER SIDE. IT REMAINS TO BE SEEN HOWEVER WHETHER THE INEVITABLE DEMISE OF THE CORNISH MAJORITY WILL HASTEN THE FEAR THAT THE AREA WILL BECOME LITTLE MORE THAN A MIDDLE CLASS DORMITORY OF PLYMOUTH.
